info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 6:28PM PDT until July 27 at 9:30PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of western Nevada, including the Conner Burn Scar and the following county, Douglas.
* WHEN...Until 930 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Heavy rains over the Conner Burn Scar may induce flooding.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 627 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding may be ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Douglas County - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Recent burn areas are more prone to flooding, debris flows, and rock falls. Plugged culverts, rocks and debris on roads, and water and mud over roads are common during moderate to heavy rains. Increased sediment and debris can lead to impacts in areas typically not prone to flooding. Use extra caution when traveling in or below recent burn areas. Impactful flooding and debris flows may be generated by 15 minutes or less of heavy rainfall.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM PDT THIS EVENING
